category: Human Rights Management Regulations/Article 24 (Installation and Function)
contents: Article 24 (Establishment and Functions) ① The Chairman shall establish a Human Rights Management Committee (hereinafter referred to as the *Committee) to efficiently promote human rights management. ② The Committee deliberates on the following matters to protect and promote the human rights of athletes, employees of sports clubs and related organizations, and stakeholders. 1. Matters pertaining to human rights management-related plans and evaluations 2. Matters pertaining to human rights management-related systems and policies 3. Matters pertaining to the work of the department in charge of human rights management 4. Matters pertaining to human rights practice and inspection obligations, including human rights impact assessment 5. The Other matters that the president or chairperson determines require deliberation ③ The committee may inspect the human rights status of sports conference facilities, business sites, policies, etc. and advise on areas for improvement. Newly established 2019. 11. 7.
